description:
It has been four months since the $34 billion expansion of Trans Mountain pipeline finally became operational, realizing the longstanding dream of getting Alberta bitumen to tidewater. This much-hyped milestone was supposed to be a gamechanger for the Alberta patch, ending the reliance on U.S. buyers by accessing new Asian markets with allegedly higher prices.  […]

The post Trudeau’s Trans Mountain Expansion Hasn’t Delivered Tidewater Benefits appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Trudeau’s Trans Mountain Expansion Hasn’t Delivered Tidewater Benefits

description:
This article by Common Dreams is published here as part of the global journalism collaboration Covering Climate Now. A trio of senior congressional Democrats on Tuesday admonished fossil fuel executives to comply with a request for “information regarding quid pro quo solicitations” from former U.S. President Donald Trump, who earlier this year promised to gut climate regulations […]

The post Dems Say Big Oil Execs Failing to Come Clean on Trump’s $1 Billion Quid Pro Quo Offer appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Dems Say Big Oil Execs Failing to Come Clean on Trump’s $1 Billion Quid Pro Quo Offer

description:
The new owner of The Spectator magazine has close financial ties to a U.S. firm with major investments in oil, gas, and coal – including several projects dubbed “carbon bombs” by campaigners. GB News co-owner Paul Marshall, who completed his purchase of The Spectator this week, is the chairman and chief investment officer of Marshall […]

The post New Spectator Boss Paul Marshall in Business With ‘Carbon Bomb’ Fossil Fuel Investor appeared first on DeSmog.
title: New Spectator Boss Paul Marshall in Business With ‘Carbon Bomb’ Fossil Fuel Investor
